title: Manhattan Travel Plan

properties.description: Posted by EcidThe walk across the bridge takes about 30 minutes and the views are awesome

properties.name: Charging Bull
properties.description: Posted by EcidBroadway & Whitehall St. (Bowling Green). The 7,000 pound bronze bull represents Wall Street optimism.

properties.name: Chase Manhattan Plaza
properties.description: Posted by EcidSurrounded by Pine, Liberty, Nassau, and William Streets, this open plaza leads to One Chase Manhattan Plaza, the first skyscraper in the Financial District built in the sleek International style. The plaza is home to the circular Sunken Garden by artist Isamu Noguchi, and Jean Debuffet\'s striking five-story-high sculpture Group of Four Trees.

properties.name: Chikalicious Dessert Bar
properties.description: Posted by EcidSome place for desserts

properties.name: Chrysler Building
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing 405 Lexington Ave, New York, NyStainless steel metal ornamented top. Automobile-derived ornamental details. Elegant lobby.

properties.name: City Hall
properties.description: Posted by EcidBroadway and Chambers St. Home of New York City\'s government. Active Mayor is Michael Bloomberg.

properties.name: Claremont school
properties.description: Posted by Ecid

properties.name: Columbus Park
properties.description: Posted by Ecid

properties.name: Doyers Street
properties.description: Posted by EcidManhattan Bridge\'s ArchOff Mott Street, running between Pell Street and Chatham Square, this unusual street features a 90-degree turn. The merchants built it crooked, according to legend, so that the straight-flying ghosts couldn\'t move through it. You may recognize the street from films and TV programs. Today you\'ll find the local post office, one of Chinatown\'s first dim sum restaurants, tea houses, and lots of barber shops.

properties.name: Eastern States Buddhist Temple on Mott Street
properties.description: Posted by EcidEastern States Buddhist TempleStep inside - your spirit will be refreshed and your eyes will be delighted by the sight of 100 golden Buddhas shimmering in the candlelight.

properties.name: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
properties.description: Posted by EcidModeled on a Florentine palace, the Federal Reserve Bank holds a quarter of the worlds gold bullion - more than Fort Knox. Tens of billions of dollars worth of gold bars are stored five stories underground, behind a 90-ton steel door.

properties.description: Posted by Ecid

properties.name: Harlem School of the Arts
properties.description: Posted by Ecid  645 Saint Nicholas Ave, New York, NY

properties.name: Hell's kitchen area
properties.description: Posted by EcidUp 34th, Down 59th. West 8th Avenue, East Hudson River.

properties.name: Manhattan bridge's arch
properties.description: Posted by EcidGet to Bowery and Canal Street to see the arch

properties.name: New York Information Technology Center
properties.description: Posted by Ecid55 Broad St Cutting-edge technology is now housed in Downtown\'s "silicon alley," a center of new multi-media and computer firms. View the wall of digital art in the lobby.

properties.name: New-York City, USA
properties.description: Posted by Phildecnew-york city

properties.name: North Cove
properties.description: Posted by EcidAt Hudson River between Liberty and Vesey Streets

properties.name: Restaurant row
properties.description: Posted by Ecid

properties.name: Staten Island Ferry
properties.description: Posted by EcidOne of New York\'s best sightseeing bargains - it\'s free - the half hour ride on the Staten Island Ferry affords the best possible views of the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, Governors Island and Downtown\'s skyline.

properties.name: Stock Exchange
properties.description: Posted by Ecid 20 Broad Street. Heart of financial trade. Billions of dollars in shares are traded every day.

properties.name: The Official Visitor Information Kiosk for Chinatown
properties.description: Posted by EcidThe Official Visitor Information Kiosk for ChinatownIt is located at the triangle where Canal, Walker, and Baxter Streets meet. The kiosk has a red and gold dragon and neon pagoda roof and there\'s an eight-foot translucent map of the area on its western wall. Hours: Sunday-Friday 10am-6pm; Saturday 10am-7pm Directions by Subway: Take the N, R, Q, W, 6, J, M, Z to Canal Street

properties.name: Trinity Church
properties.description: Posted by EcidTrinity Church/St. Paul\'s Chapel, a national landmark built in 1766
